main event: A UFO sighting was reported on 13th October 1959, approximately 18 miles north of Terre Haute, Indiana, involving a single unidentified object observed by military aviation radar.
interesting points: The object was described as being round, hazy around the edges, and resembling a flashlight shining through fog or a green flare through an overcast.
It was reported to be a distinct green light, descending rapidly and disappearing almost instantaneously.
The observation was made by reliable witnesses, including Captain Kenneth D. Brooks and Lieutenant John W. Kimmerly, both flying in a T-28A aircraft at the time.
Weather conditions at the time were described as a soft haze in a clear sky with haze above them.
The total time of the sighting lasted less than one second, and the object could have resembled a commercial searchlight due to its brightness around the edges.
sighted object: a distinct green light resembling a flashlight shining through fog or a green flare
location: 18 miles north of Terre Haute, Indiana
witnesses: reliable witnesses, including military aviation radar and pilots
